p: The differences in vitamin composition between T. occidentalis plants cultivated on gas flared (Egbema) and non-gas flared (Umudike) soils showed no statistical differences in any of the vitamin concentrations measured in T. occidentalis from the untreated gas flared and non-gas flared soils ( Table 3). The vitamin concentrations of T. occidentalis grown on gas flared remediated soil were higher than those on non-gas flared soil for 7.1 t ha −1 and 13.9 t ha −1 biochar treated plants, suggesting that 13.9 t ha −1 biochar treatment promoted vitamin synthesis. The result agrees with that of Lou et al. [ 29] who reported increased vitamin C concentration in cabbage grown with an aqueous extract of maize straw biochar.
